com.xhive.federationset.interfaces
Interface XhiveFederationSetIf

public interface XhiveFederationSetIf

Represents a set of federations maintained in a federation set description file. This provides a simple way to create a server for a set of federations, using a single page cache and TCP/IP listen port.

A federation set can also contain references to other federation sets, which can be used together with the federations mentioned directly.

Any relative paths to federations or nested federation sets are interpreted relative to the federation set description file.

Since:
X-Hive/DB 7.0

Method Detail

createFederationSet

void createFederationSet(java.lang.String filename)
                         throws java.io.IOException
Create a new federation set on the same machine as this federation set. This does not add the new federation set to the federation set map of this federation set.

Parameters:
filename - Name of the new federation set description file.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 7.0
See Also:
XhiveFederationSetFactory.createFederationSet(String)

deleteFederationSet

void deleteFederationSet(java.lang.String filename)
                         throws java.io.IOException
Delete a federation set description file on the same machine as this federation set. This does not remove the federation set from the federation set map of this federation set. The federation set to delete can be this federation set.

The implementation simply deletes the specified file, without checking that it is in fact a federation set.

Parameters:
filename - Name of the federation set description file to delete.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 7.0

getFederationMap

java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getFederationMap()
Get the map of federations of this federation set. The map maps a user provided name to a bootstrap file or url. Putting something in this map adds it to the federation set description file.

The implementation of the methods in this map can cause a java.io.IOException to be thrown. Because the java.util.Map interface does not allow these exceptions to be declared, they will be wrapped in a java.lang.RuntimeException.

Returns:
The federations map.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 7.0

getFederation

XhiveDriverIf getFederation(java.lang.String name)
Get a driver for a named federation. The driver will be initialized with the page cache provided when retrieving this federation set. Application code should not call the init methods of the driver directly.

Parameters:
name - The name of the federation as a key in the federations map.
Returns:
An initialized X-Hive/DB driver object or null if the name cannot be found.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 7.0
See Also:
XhiveDriverIf.init(XhivePageCacheIf)

getFederationSetMap

java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getFederationSetMap()
Get the map of (nested) federation sets of this federation set. The map maps a user provided name to a description file or url. Putting something in this map adds it to the federation set description file.

The implementation of the methods in this map can cause a java.io.IOException to be thrown. Because the java.util.Map interface does not allow these exceptions to be declared, they will be wrapped in a java.lang.RuntimeException.

Returns:
The federation sets map.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 7.0

getFederationSet

XhiveFederationSetIf getFederationSet(java.lang.String name)
                                      throws java.io.IOException
Get a (nested) named federation set. It will use the same page cache as was used for this federation set.

Parameters:
name - The name of the federation set as a key in the federation set map.
Returns:
A federation set or null if the name cannot be found.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 7.0

setSocketFactory

void setSocketFactory(javax.net.SocketFactory socketFactory)
Set the socket factory to initialize any X-Hive/DB driver objects. Note that every call to XhiveFederationSetFactory.getFederation(String, XhivePageCacheIf) returns a new object and that the socket factory is only set on the particular instance that this method is called on.

Parameters:
socketFactory - The socket factory to use.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 7.0
See Also:
XhiveDriverIf.init(XhivePageCacheIf, SocketFactory)

acceptConnection

void acceptConnection(java.net.Socket socket)
Use the provided socket as a connection to this federation set. This can be useful if for some reason you need to run your own listener thread.

Parameters:
socket - The socket to use for a remote connection.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 7.0

startListenerThread

void startListenerThread(java.net.ServerSocket serverSocket)
Starts a thread that listens on the specified server socket to accept connections from remote clients. If you close the socket, the listening thread will exit. This method can be called multiple times to listen to multiple server sockets.

Because a federation set does not have a separate authentication mechanism, you should be careful with this method.

Parameters:
serverSocket - The server socket to listen for client connections.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 7.0
